snippet: Ukraine on Monday accused separatists fighters of firing on a caravan of cars carrying refugees, but rebel leaders denied there had been any attack.
abstract: Ukrainian military officials say separatist rebels attacked caravan of cars carrying refugees trying to flee war-ravaged eastern Ukraine, killing 'dozens' of people; rebel leaders deny there had been an attack.

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER, ANDREW HIGGINS and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Donetsk; Andrew Higgins from Kiev, Ukraine; and David M. Herszenhorn from Moscow. Andrew Roth contributed reporting from Donetsk, Russia, and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Ukraine on Monday accused separatists fighters of firing on a caravan of cars carrying refugees, but rebel leaders denied there had been any attack.

headline.main: Rebels Killed Dozens in Attack on Refugees, Ukraine Says
headline.print_headline: Rebels Killed Dozens in Attack on Refugee Caravan, Ukraine Says

keywords.value: International Committee of the Red Cross
keywords.name: organizations
